ygData.subject: Re: Down the rabbit hole (Tuscon & Rodimus)
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson was not about to give up. He had come a long way, and it wouldn t be for nothing. He couldn t transform into robot mode, only to risk losing Vestige,

Tucson was not about to give up. He had come a long way, and it wouldn't be=
 for nothing. He couldn't transform into robot mode, only to risk losing Ve=
stige, who he knew was very important to this quest. He would have to charg=
e in vehicle mode, hoping to Primus he could bust through with using simple=
 blast cannons on his cab.  He aims the cannons, as they begin to glow with=
 bright plasma energy, firing up within the chambers of the weapons.

" I s=
wore by the name of Primus that I would succeed in my quest to rescue Rodim=
us Prime and bring him to saftey.  Nothing, not even a self absorbed, greed=
 filled horde as yourselves can keep me separated from what is most valuabl=
e to me!  No amount of power will ever overcome the one thing that Autobots=
 and Maximals possess.  You have no compassion for others, or faith in comr=
adery.  Nor do you have genuine trust among your ranks.  To you power is th=
e survival of the fittest, and that alone will not shield you from adversit=
y."

He now delves deeper into his heart spark.  He senses Rodimus's encour=
aging words, and a feeling of warmpth builds gradually within him.  Now onl=
y if he could get that to Rodimus Prime.  So he attempts to send a silent c=
om to Rodimus, hoping that in this realm his voice could be heard.

" Rodim=
us, if ever there were a time for courage and strength, it is now.  You hav=
e within you the power to relight the flame, and all you need do, is look d=
eeper into your heart.  There you will find it, a power that is perpetual, =
a power that is unmatched by anything ever devised in the universe, and a o=
ne true power that as Autobots, we share among each other.  Be not afraid t=
o delve into this power, as I too am not afraid to do the same.  My heart i=
s here for you, all you need to is reach for it." 

Inside Tucson's cab, a =
screen shows the image of a beating heart. As it beats further, the inside =
of the cab glows a brilliant silvery blue light. A light that eminates from=
 his heart, and a light that can not be doused by the forces of evil.

--- =
In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> >=
<OLD>
> >
> > Tucson Prime continues on his path, and keeps at a good but s=
afe speed through the tunnel. He knew that going too fast could upset the s=
tructure even weaken it to the point of breaking, which he did not want to =
do. He continues steadilly, sensing that Vestige was growing weak once more=
. Gently, he begins to take control of his own wheel, and goes in the direc=
tion of where he's being led.
> >
> > "It's all right old friend, you have =
given me the course, I can take it from here. Rest now. I promise we will r=
each the chamber in time for you to be repaired."
> >
> > With each word Tu=
cson speaks, his voice changes ever so slightly, sounding more and more lik=
e Optimus Prime. Still he himself has no idea that he was ever related to t=
he great Autobot leader. All he knew is that he admired him greatly not onl=
y as his commander, but as a mentor during his younger years as a rookie Au=
tobot. Tucson could now sense some changes within himself, not only on the =
outside, but on the inside as well. He could have turned to fight whatever =
onslaught was following him, yet he chose not to, and chose to save a life =
over taking one. It was a choice he felt very good about and had no regrets=
 to his decision.
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> As Tuscon moved foward the trip was fairl=
y easy at first. The walls
> and floor were smooth and well made. The halls=
, while somewhat dim
> were still well lit, especially with the help of his=
 headlights. And
> while weak Vesitge still tried to hold on, slightly guid=
ing Tuscon via
> the sterring wheel to tell him which turns to make and how=
 fast to go.
> 
> However as time went on it was easy to see that Vestige w=
as still
> slipping away, his hold on the wheel becoming more and more slac=
k as
> time went on. Also the strange things is that the walls and floor we=
re
> changing with distance as well. The metal deckplating was becoming
> r=
ougher and rougher, going from the silver and grey of metal to the
> brown =
and blacks of something strange almost chitinous or shell like.
> The walls=
 began to take on a decidely dark brown cast, and instead of
> thier smooth=
 gleaming surface they began to get rough and jagged,
> almost like claws a=
nd thorns that sometimes forced Tuscon to slow down
> to navigate around th=
em.
> 
> Outside the vehicle the ominous buzzing sound was getting louder a=
nd
> louder as Tuscon moved foward, while inside his cab Vestige weakly
> g=
estured and tried to help. The tunnel straightened as Tuscon drove,
> but i=
t had also gotten steadily darker and more dangerous, the ground
> beneath =
him now feeling more like earth and stone than metal. However
> ahead of hi=
m he could see a gleaming light. It was as if a door
> suddenly opened at t=
he end of a long hall and a light that beckoned
> Tuscon towards it, but if=
 it was to victory or destruction it was
> difficult to tell.
> 
> Outside =
Tuscon could hear comming from the direction of the light the
> clear voice=
 of Rodimus, "I AM HERE! DRIVE TUSCON! DRIVE!"
> 
> Meanwhile Inside Tuscon=
's cab Vestige slumped over, even as several
> large insect-spider like cre=
atures seem to melt out from the darkness
> in front of the door and stand =
guard over it.
> 
> "We are the horde, and you will go no further!!" The cr=
eatures rush
> foward to attack!
